Class DisplayControl

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent

All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, Composite, Composite.CompositeComponent, Composite.CompositeService, Composite.CompositeWidget, ApplicationComponent, ApplicationService, ApplicationWidget, Service, Control<Object>, FormElementAware<Object,Object>, Viewable, Viewable.ViewableComponent, Viewable.ViewableService, Viewable.ViewableWidget, Widget
public class DisplayControl
extends BaseControl<Object>

This class represents a read only control, that is technically it is not a true control, but just a label displaying the text to the user.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DisplayControl

public DisplayControl()
Method Detail

isRead

public boolean isRead()
By default the control is considered read if it has a not null data read from request.

Due to the purpose of DisplayControl, this methods always returns false.

Specified by:
isRead in interface Control<Object>
Overrides:
isRead in class BaseControl<Object>
Returns:
false.

getRawValueType

public DataType getRawValueType()
Description copied from interface: Control
This method should be overridden by the control, returning the type of the value of this control. It is later used in ConverterFactory to determine the BaseConverter used to transfer the values from Datato control and back.

Returns:
The type of the value of this control as specified in the given DataType object.

getViewModel

public DisplayControl.ViewModel getViewModel()
Returns the DisplayControl.ViewModel of this DisplayControl for rendering the control.

Overrides:
getViewModel in class BaseControl<Object>
Returns:
The DisplayControl.ViewModel of this DisplayControl.
